data.name: Aggron

attacks.name: Second Strike
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Guard Claw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Aggron by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: You can tell its age by the length of its iron horns. It claims an entire mountain as its territory.

attacks.name: Heavy Blow
attacks.text: Does 70 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Aggron. If Aggron has any React Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 70 damage instead.

attacks.name: Bound Crush
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) During your next turn, Aggron can't use Bound Crush.

data.name: Team Magma's Aggron
rules: This Pokémon is both Fighting Darkness type.

attacks.name: Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to Team Magma's Aggron. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Land Stream
attacks.text: You may discard any number of basic Energy cards attached to Team Magma's Aggron. If you do, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each basic Energy card you discarded.

data.name: Aggron

attacks.name: Heap Up
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for all Energy cards and show them to your opponent. If you find any Metal Special Energy cards there this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage. Put all of those Energy cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hard Metal
attacks.text: You may do 60 damage plus 40 more damage. If you do, Aggron does 40 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Aggron.

attacks.name: Double Lariat
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Terraforming
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 5 cards from your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order. This power can't be used if Aggron is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Mix-Up
attacks.text: Your opponent discards the top card of his or her deck.

attacks.name: Return Blow
attacks.text: If Aggron was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does the same amount of damage done to Aggron to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Metal Fang
attacks.text: You may discard the top card of your deck. If you do, remove 2 damage counters and all Special Conditions from Aggron.

data.name: Team Magma's Aggron

attacks.name: Rock Stomp
attacks.text: Discard as many Fighting Energy attached to your Pokémon as you like. This attack does 40 damage times the amount of Fighting Energy you discarded.

attacks.name: Boulder Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Aggron's metal horns can smash through any defenses, no matter how strong!

data.name: Aggron

attacks.name: Knock Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aura of the Land
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It claims an entire mountain as its own. The more wounds it has, the more it has battled, so don't take it lightly.

data.name: Aggron

attacks.name: Revenge Cannon
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on all of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Buster Swing
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: It claims an entire mountain as its own. The more wounds it has, the more it has battled, so don't take it lightly.

data.name: Aggron

abilities.name: Toppling Wind
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Giga Horn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.

data.name: Aggron-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Steel Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Raging Hammer
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: M Aggron-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Megaton Slam
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 120 more damage. If tails, this attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Aggron ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Intimidating Armor
abilities.text: As long as Aggron ex is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Basic Pokémon can't attack or use any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies.

attacks.name: Split Bomb
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack doe 30 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mega Burn
attacks.text: During your next turn, Aggron ex can't use Mega Burn.

data.name: Aggron ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Metal Surge
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Aggron Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Aggron-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Aggron

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has full HP and would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, it is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

data.flavorText: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.

data.name: Aggron

attacks.name: Extra-Tight Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 8 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: It claims an entire mountain as its own. The more wounds it has, the more it has battled, so don't take it lightly.

data.name: Aggron-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Steel Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Raging Hammer
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: M Aggron-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Megaton Slam
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 120 more damage. If tails, this attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Aggron

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Seismic Rift
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to each of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.

data.name: Aggron V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Merciless Strike
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 150 more damage.

data.name: Aggron VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cracking Stomp
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Max Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Aggron

attacks.name: Counter Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon equal to the damage done to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Aggron has a horn sharp enough to perforate thick iron sheets. It brings down its opponents by ramming into them horn first.

data.name: Aggron

attacks.name: Angry Slam
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Guard Claw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 50 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Aggron has a horn sharp enough to perforate thick iron sheets. It brings down its opponents by ramming into them horn first.
